title: Steffi Graf
summary: Stefanie Maria Graf (German pronunciation: [ˈʃtɛfiː ˈɡʁaːf], audio ;[4][5] born 14 June 1969) is a German former professional tennis player. She was ranked world No. 1 for a record 377 weeks and won 22 major singles titles,[6] the second-most since the start of the Open Era in 1968 and third-most of all-time behind Margaret Court (24) and Serena Williams (23). In 1988, she became the first tennis player to achieve the Golden Slam by winning all four Grand Slam singles titles and the Olympic gold medal in the same calendar year.[7] Furthermore, she is the only tennis player, male or female, to have won each major at least four times.
